ai-mil4.6:1.1_0: The elder replied, “Very well,” and after accepting the ten perfections, and he presented ten of lay followers.
ai-mil4.6:1.2_0: “Great king, these ten virtues of laymen are seen, Great King,
ai-mil4.6:1.3_0: What are the ten things that make them happy and pleased when they have undertaken.
ai-mil4.6:1.4_0: He has right view, responsible for the sake of veneration, or for the sake of a teacher, and for the sake of another religion, he hasn’t confused the sake of their own life. He has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha. And his teaching, has gone for refuge to the Buddha, it is not a perfected one, and has gone for refuge to the Dhamma.
ai-mil4.6:1.5_0: These ten kinds of lay followers—whether all of these kinds of sensual stimulation as are found in you, having seen the local lay followers of the ascetic life, when you ask me about your bowl, you’re happy.”
ai-mil4.6:2.1_0: The discussion on Meṇḍaka is finished.
